body_content.explanation: A situation in which an industry or a factory is producing more than it can sell:
examples: A recent surge in steel consumption has reduced global overcapacity in the steel industry.
The merger will reduce overcapacity, cut costs, and increase efficiency.
The company's annual results have been seriously affected by over-capacity.

body_content.explanation: the state of being more or greater in amount than what can be contained:
examples: Most maternity units are working at overcapacity.
The screaming, over-capacity crowd was jammed into the venue.
